Posts.Content: Singapore has both the National Cancer Centre and the Parkway Cancer Centre. (Click on the names to go to the web page.) China has the Peking University Cancer Hospital, in Beijing. I don't have much knowledge of any of these places as I am in the US. Good luck to you and your sister.
Posts.Title: Looking for cancer hospital

Posts.Content: I'm so sorry to hear this. That sounds like a very fast moving and aggressive cancer. It makes me wonder if the first scan was correct. But if it's moving that fast, then unfortunately it may continue to do so. I hope that they have given her painkillers.
Posts.Title: diagnosed last stage breast cancer

Posts.Content: Since you don't have a diagnosis, I've moved your post to the "Worried" forum. It all sounds pretty routine to me. Keep calm and let us know.
Posts.Title: Why do I have to wait a week?

Posts.Content: I am so sorry for the loss of your mother. Apparently breast cancer can be really, really aggressive sometimes; what a terrible shock for your family.
Posts.Title: diagnosed last stage breast cancer

Posts.Content: Terri, sorry to hear of your troubles; some people who work in doctor's offices, and even some doctors themselves, are sometimes insensitive clods. Therefore it's quite likely that they had no idea whatsoever how much distress they were going to cause you by changing the date of your appointment. Deep breaths; you don't have cancer until a biopsy report says you do; worry serves no useful purpose other than to get you to act and you are already being proactive. Good luck and let us know how it goes.
Posts.Title: I can't believe it...

Posts.Content: Radiologists are more or less required to deliver the worst-case scenario in their reports. Until the biopsy reports comes in and says it's cancer, it isn't. If it turns out that you can't work due to illness and treatment, then you are elibigible for disability. To apply you'll need to go to the social security office with the exact diagnosis plus all the contact info for your doctor and your employer. But that's down the road.

Posts.Title: Results...

Posts.Content: You'd have to ask the doctor, but everything you describe sure sounds like classic Dex side effects. I think it's unusual to be on Dex for a year with no breaks. There are other dangers, like muscle atrophy. I would ask questions of the doctor about this.
Posts.Title: Phenominal response to steroids. Is this the norm?

Posts.Title: Results...

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by BenL My gut is, along side her continuing supplements and diet (which seem to be a good idea for anyone - all of us - as a means to boost our immune system and, otherwise, stay healthy) is to find an oncologist in whom we trust, and go from there. Your gut is correct. I hope you are able to convince her.

Posts.Title: Conventional Treatment vs. Complimentary

Posts.Content: I know how anxiety-inducing these waiting times can be. Hopefully you'll hear something soon and, if it does turn out to be a metastis, get a plan of action in place soon. By the way, since your girlfriend was actually diagnosed with breast cancer, feel free to post in that forum. Would you like me to move your post there?
Posts.Title: Scary Day Today
